column1: Soft tissue sarcoma is cancer that forms in the soft tissue of the body.

But there are certain risk factors: - Some inherited diseases, such as Li-Fraumeni Syndrome - Radiation therapy for other cancers - Exposure to certain chemicals, such as vinyl chloride or certain herbicides - Having swelling in the arms or legs for a long time (lymphedema)
Other symptoms include: - Pain, if it presses on a nerve, organ, blood vessel, or muscle - Blockage or bleeding in the stomach or intestines - Breathing problems
In a biopsy, your provider collects a tissue sample to examine in the lab.
Surgery is the most common treatment.
- With advanced cancers that form in an arm or leg, surgery may be followed by radiation or chemotherapy.

You also may have radiation or chemotherapy: - Used before surgery to help shrink the tumor to make it easier to remove the cancer - Used after surgery to kill any remaining cancer cells Chemotherapy may be used to help kill cancer that has metastasized.
Ask your provider to help you find a support group for people who have been diagnosed with soft tissue cancer.
